conclusion: Analyze the motion of objects A and B before and after the string breaks.
Objects A and B are attached to a string over a pulley, with A hanging vertically and B on an inclined plane.
Forces acting on object A are its weight and tension in the string.
Forces acting on object B are its weight, normal force, and tension in the string.
Component of weight of object B along the inclined plane is mg sin θ.
Set up equations of motion for objects A and B.
Combine and add equations to solve for acceleration a.
Calculate acceleration a = 2 m/s² using θ = 37° and sin 37° = 0.6.
Calculate time for object A to fall using h = 1/2 a t².
Determine time t = 1 s for object A to fall.
Calculate velocity of object B using v = at.
Velocity of object B is 2 m/s when the string breaks.
After string breaks, only force on object B is component of its weight along inclined plane.
Determine acceleration a' = g sin θ for object B.
Calculate acceleration a' = 6 m/s² for object B.
Use kinematic equation v = u + a't to calculate time for object B to return to bottom.
Determine time t = 1/3 s for object B to return to bottom.
Final answer: Time required for object B to return to bottom is 1/3 s.
